intro: Melampyrum stenophyllum, commonly known as narrow-leaved touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with two lips, and are arranged in racemes. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
